p: The 1b subtype is widely considered to be a major contributor to infection in Chinese cattle [ 20, 22]. Similarly, BVDV-1b is also a main subtype in Chinese goat herds [ 13]. BVDV transmission among different animal species has been proven and, therefore, increased surveillance of BVDV infection in goats should be an important factor to consider in the control and understanding of BVDV infection in cattle.
